title: ATO / myGov tax scams (fake recalculation, refunds, threats)
summary: Scammers impersonate the ATO or myGov to steal logins or identity details, often using ‘refund’ or ‘urgent notice’ bait.
how_it_works: You receive an email/text claiming your tax has been recalculated or you’re owed money.
You’re told to click a link to log into myGov or provide TFN/ID documents.
Scammers use your details for identity theft or to redirect refunds.
warning_signs: Message asks you to log in via a link or provide TFN/licence/Medicare details.
Threats about penalties/arrest or urgent deadlines.
Sender address/domain doesn’t match the real service.
example_hooks: “Taxable income recalculated — view your new notice.”
“You are due compensation/refund — reply with your TFN and ID.”
what_to_do: Access myGov by typing my.gov.au yourself or using the official app.
Don’t send identity documents to unexpected requests.
Report the scam and contact relevant agencies if details were shared.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
